page.title: 14Co-Operative Farming - ELGRO
page.content:
ELGRO stands for East Lincolnshire Growers Ltd. Elgro is a marketing co-operative based in Kirton. The co-operative was formed in 1964 with a membership of 28. This number has steadily grown to 39 and the acreage of vegetables and potatoes under contract now exceeds 5700 acres.
Cauliflowers 1200 acres Potatoes 1800 acres Onions 1600 acres Brussel Sprouts 600 acres Cabbages 600 acres
Other vegetables that are handled at Elgro include calabrese, leeks, sweet corn, beans, and peppers. The above acres are the current acreages of the principle crops committed to Elgro by its membership.
